006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util;
007
008import java.util.function.Function;
009import java.util.regex.Matcher;
010import java.util.regex.Pattern;
011
012import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
013
014public final class ReplacementScanner {
015  private ReplacementScanner() {
016    // disable construction
017  }
018
019  /**
020   * Search for instances of {@code pattern} in {@code text}. Replace each
021   * matching occurrence using the {@code replacementFunction}.
022   *
023   * @param text
024   *          the text to search
025   * @param pattern
026   *          the pattern to search for
027   * @param replacementFunction
028   *          a function that will provided the replacement text
029   * @return the resulting text after replacing matching occurrences in
030   *         {@code text}
031   */
032  public static CharSequence replaceTokens(@NonNull CharSequence text, @NonNull Pattern pattern,
033      Function<Matcher, CharSequence> replacementFunction) {
034    int lastIndex = 0;
035    StringBuilder retval = new StringBuilder();
036    Matcher matcher = pattern.matcher(text);
037    while (matcher.find()) {
038      retval.append(text, lastIndex, matcher.start())
039          .append(replacementFunction.apply(matcher));
040
041      lastIndex = matcher.end();
042    }
043    if (lastIndex < text.length()) {
044      retval.append(text, lastIndex, text.length());
045    }
046    return retval;
047  }
048}
